text:
If you configure mod_ssl with an SSLMutex file: with a directory path where
the last directory componenet does not exist Apache core dumps with a 
segmentation fault.

This has been reproduced on the following systems.

Sun Netra X1 running Solaris 8 using Sun CC compiler.
PC running Solaris 7 x86 using gcc 2.95.3

The segmentation fault is generated within apr_global_mutex_create.

mod_ssl does not generate any error messages that there is an invalid
directory path for the SSLMutex file: configuration.
creator: glenn@apache.org
trawick@apache.org
text:
There is a bug in the cleanup logic in the APR mutex routines for fcntl and
flock - it tries to close the file even if the file couldn't be opened.

With that fixed, you'll see something like this in the Apache log for a
misconfiguration like yours:

[error] (2)No such file or directory: Cannot create SSLMutex file `/tmp/a/b/c.54359'

Changing to product APR now, fix coming shortly.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
This has been fixed in APR CVS and will be in the next
release of Apache and APR.

Thanks for your report!
